First off, we should understand what is meant by "longevity" in this context. Since this question is comparing the longevity of Northwest Airlines and Betty White, we can assume it refers to the length of time each entity has been in existence. 

Northwest Airlines was founded on September 1, 1926, and merged with Delta Airlines on October 29, 2008. Based on these dates, we can calculate that Northwest Airlines existed for approximately 82 years. 

In comparison, Betty White, born on January 17, 1922, is currently 99 years old as of the time of writing. Therefore, Betty White's longevity (her lifespan so far) has surpassed Northwest Airlines' existence by 17 years. 

Thus, the answer to the question is (B) no, Northwest Airlines' longevity did not surpass Betty White's.
